What are we?

OLLI at Auburn is a membership program for learning in retirement for senior adults, 50 years and older.

Who are we?

Linda Shook

OLLI Director

Linda Shook holds a M.Ed. in Adult Education from Auburn University. She received a B.A. in public relations with a minor in human resource management from The University of Alabama. Currently, she serves as the director for the Osher Lifelong Learning Institute at Auburn University (OLLI at Auburn). She has been affiliated with OLLI at Auburn since 2008. Prior to this, she worked for non-profit organizations and has many years of experience in volunteer management.

Barbara Daron

OLLI Coordinator

Barbara Daron holds a M.Ed. in Reading Education from Auburn University Montgomery and received a B.S. in Education from Auburn University. Currently, she serves as the OLLI at Auburn Coordinator. She has been employed at Auburn University since 2012 and has been affiliated with the University since 1992. Prior to working at Auburn, Barbara taught elementary school in rural Alabama and worked with many at-risk students.

Executive Committee, 2014-2015

  • Emily Kling President
  • John Neubauer Vice President
  • Virginia O'Leary Secretary
  • Jane Brown Treasury
  • Linda Shook Director

You can join. Sound interesting?

There are no formal requirements for membership other than an interest in continued learning. One need not be fully retired, nor are there academic or experience requirements.

This needs to be filled in better.
